for EXISTING customers  the KEY figure is your 31st July DAY END balance...Incremental balance is compared against THAT static figure
So it‚Äôs ok if I transfer most of my funds now if my 31st July balance is fairly low?
i don't know what is your definition of low..If your 31st July DAY END balance is $1000  then EVERYTHING above $1k will earn 3.55% p.a.

Hi guys  any expert knows how to transition smoothly from OCBC 360 to UOB One? Details here:https://www.reddit.com/r/singaporefi/comments/15y0qfk/how_to_utilise_uob_one_account_in_my_case/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=android_app&utm_name=androidcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=2
just move 100k over from OCBC 360 to UOB One on the 1st of the month
assuming you already got your UOB Card and ready to spend
The spend criteria is based on calendar month so no need to consider billing cycle

If u are just comparing with your regular saving account ‚Ä¶ yes it has better interest rates ‚Ä¶But if u compare to other lobang share here u might get better returns ‚Ä¶ all depend on wat u want to do with your money
For those who successfully setup UOB cc bill payment using giro to HSBC EGA were there any notifications once the giro setup was completed?
HSBC April bonus interest is in~
When GIRO setup completed is not important. Most Important is if there is a GIRO payment instructions printed on the credit card statement or not.Read thishttps://t.me/HoneyMoneySG/95726
sigh nothing for me... i am on alternate months so I will only get March and May bonus interest.
you MUST wait for your credit card statement to have the GIRO comment under Payment section before it is deemed completed

update:its correct based on statement  but statement itself is wrong.I deposited a few amounts since 11 March  but the transactions from 11-12 March are shown as 13 March on HSBC statement.(Checked tx dates on DBS account where the funds were transferred from).If i update my calculations based on that then its correctSo its like S$12.68 difference if they were counted on the actual dates
